availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thaddeus C. Campbell (Maysville, Mason Co attorney)

body.p: Maysville attorney. Mason County, Kentucky native. Married Angeline Campbell. Father of Mary Campbell and Grace Campbell. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1848. Held one slave in 1860.

bibl.p: “The Late T. C. Campbell,” The Evening Bulletin (Maysville, Ky, September 19, 1901. H. Charles Ulman, Lawyers’ Record and Official Register of the United States: Containing Federal Officers of Bureaus and Departments; Foreign Ministers and Consuls; State, County, and City Officials, Judiciary, With Jurisdiction and Time of Holding Courts; Blank Legal Forms; and A Record of Practicing Lawyers throughout the United States (New York: A. S. Barnes and Company, 1872), p. 533. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, District 1, p. 49. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 15. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 1. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Kentucky, Ninth Congressional District, Sub district 6, 1863, p. 25. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 23.
